revised_title: Evolution and Morphological Development of Reefs in the Northern Great Barrier Reef
tldr: This article discusses the evolution and morphological development of reefs in the northern Great Barrier Reef, focusing on the impact of sea level changes since the last glacial low stand. The authors analyze shallow coring, surface geomorphology, lithology, vegetation patterns, and radiometric dating to understand the sequence of reef and island development in Holocene time. They also explore the transition from vertical to horizontal reef growth and discuss latitudinal variations in reef forms along the Great Barrier Reef.
